column1: 4104740820,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-data-analyst-at-scalapay-4104740820?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=qJtGlg75BmolBhpKoqD1nA%3D%3D&trackingId=MUGqsms6UFoJ2Oi0QzB%2FQw%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Data Analyst,Scalapay,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 6.5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn‚Äôt stop us from becoming a unicorn ü¶Ñ We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.
This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ‚ô•

Our data team seeks a Business Intelligence Data Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with Scalapay‚Äôs key Business Units such as Product, Marketing and Sales, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.
Serve as the data point of reference for our key Business Units, providing them with necessary support
Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement
Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making
Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights
Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data
Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes
Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation
Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay
Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling.
You‚Äôll be great for this role if:
You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with a background in startups or fintech
You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus
You are proficient in data visualisation tools and data storytelling
You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses
You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way
You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas
You‚Äôre more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!
Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary we have for this position is up to 40'000‚Ç¨ (Gross Annual Base)
International environment with significant challenges to be met every day
Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences
Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.
Initial Chat: A brief conversation with our Talent Acquisition team
Hiring Manager Interview: A deep dive into your experience and motivation for the role
Case Study: A skills-based test with a debriefing session involving key stakeholders, conducted in our Milan office
Final Chat with Simone (CEO): An opportunity to discuss Scalapay‚Äôs values and assess cultural alignment.
Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.
Pro tip: send your CV in English üòâ
Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but‚Ä¶ we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.
We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

L‚ÄôOpen Banking √® il nostro DNA!

Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone‚Äôs life.

column1: Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.
üöÄ Join us as Data Analyst and let's make magic happen together.

As a Data Analyst, you will join the Tech & Product team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product, Engineering, Marketing and Business Development teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.
Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the product and business line through research and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions.
Analyze and drive. Analyze and interpret datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
Design and optimize experiments. Develop and manage A/B tests to optimize and guide product and processes enhancements.
Create and maintain descriptive outcomes. Track key metrics and assist in the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) to communicate analytical insights effectively.
Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Cooperate. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data into broader business strategies.
Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.

Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 3+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios.

Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.

Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.

Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

About Satispay

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments
column2:
we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone‚Äôs life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

üöÄ Join us as Data Analyst and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview

As a Data Analyst, you will join the Tech &
column3:
Product team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product, Engineering, Marketing and Business Development teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.

Your Mission

  • Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the product and business line through research and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions.
  • Analyze and drive. Analyze and interpret datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
  • Design and optimize experiments. Develop and manage A/B tests to optimize and guide product and processes enhancements.
  • Create and maintain descriptive outcomes. Track key metrics and assist in the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) to communicate analytical insights effectively.
  • Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability.
  • Cooperate. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data into broader business strategies.
  • Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
  • Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.

Your Ideal Profile

  • Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 3+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios.
  • Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.
  • Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
  • Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
  • Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.

Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

4121361232,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-visualization-at-sky-italia-4121361232?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=qJtGlg75BmolBhpKoqD1nA%3D%3D&trackingId=%2FR%2FWtXyTOjSwjjDgI9MAzQ%3D%3D,Data Visualization,Sky Italia,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","About the job
As a visualisation data engineer manager,
You will design and deliver reporting solutions of excellent quality leveraging data from our new cloud platform while meeting business expectations

You‚Äôll develop your career and be responsible for the creation of clear, reliable and informative dashboards while taking an active role helping us define what good looks like in our visualisation capability.
You will explore a large amount of data and analyze complex phenomena that impact the Sky business
You will interact will business stakeholders understanding the need and proposing the best approach to data representation
You will join an agile team, whose main scope is to drive the of Sky‚Äôs transformation into a modern Data Driven Company
You will be part of a major International Data Hub
Be part of the Data Visualization Practice within the Data Platform team, mentoring and coaching other members of the team
Manage, monitor and develop the data visualization platform in terms of licenses and organizational definition, interacting with Sky group and local teams
Work within an international team for the management of data visualization services

Proactively identify opportunities to improve and rationalise applications and processes across all squads within the team, working in close collaboration with other team members and subject matter experts
Continuously implement, promote and improve our ways of working, defining best practice, frameworks and processes

Co-work with colleagues of other business units with different backgrounds, cultures and roles to design innovative solutions, contributing with a deep domain knowledge and highlighting opportunities, risks and challenges
Work closely with Data Custodians and Data Governance experts to achieve high data quality standards
Work as a key member within a squad - understand and contribute to the agile delivery process and take ownership for your team‚Äôs software quality from concept to production
Drive forward the production of reusable code and modules where appropriate with a view to maximising effort and reducing development costs by applying principles of Agile delivery
At least five years experience on Tableau or similar visualisation tools in complex business projects
Proven experience working with large, complex datasets in a cloud environment.
At least five years experience on SQL applied to enterprise grade projects
Extensive data analysis and interpretation background to critically evaluate data gathered from various sources, helping key partners understand and maximise the potential of data
Self-motivator with energy and drive for continuous improvement and a focus on delivering results
Proven ability to influence technical decisions in a fast-moving commercial environment
Demonstrates exceptional communication and social skills and has a demonstrable ability to influence technical decisions in a fast paced commercial environment
Attitude to act as a business translator to address with a faster pace analytic requirement, keeping high quality standards
Ability to 'think outside the box' to come up with pragmatic solutions to de-risks and solve issues
Ability to adapt to technological and business priority changes
Lean and/or Agile practice is appreciated
Data Governance principles knowledge is appreciated
Proven experience on cloud-based solutions is appreciated
Experience on Python, R or equivalent query languages will be a plus
If you‚Äôre ready to work in a dynamic environment alongside talented people who take pride in delivering great results, apply today.

About the job

As a visualisation data engineer manager,

  • You will design and deliver reporting solutions of excellent quality leveraging data from our new cloud platform while meeting business expectations
  • You‚Äôll develop your career and be responsible for the creation of clear, reliable and informative dashboards while taking an active role helping us define what good looks like in our visualisation capability.
  • You will explore a large amount of data and analyze complex phenomena that impact the Sky business
  • You will interact will business stakeholders understanding the need and proposing the best approach to data representation
  • You will join an agile team, whose main scope is to drive the of Sky‚Äôs transformation into a modern Data Driven Company
  • You will be part of a major International Data Hub



What You'll Do


  • Be part of the Data Visualization Practice within the Data Platform team, mentoring and coaching other members of the team
  • Manage, monitor and develop the data visualization platform in terms of licenses and organizational definition, interacting with Sky group and local teams
  • Work within an international team for the management of data visualization services
  • Proactively identify opportunities to improve and rationalise applications and processes across all squads within the team, working in close collaboration with other team members and subject matter experts
  • Continuously implement, promote and improve our ways of working, defining best practice, frameworks and processes
  • Co-work with colleagues of other business units with different backgrounds, cultures and roles to design innovative solutions, contributing with a deep domain knowledge and highlighting opportunities, risks and challenges

Work closely with Data Custodians and Data Governance experts to achieve high data quality standards

  • Work as a key member within a squad - understand and contribute to the agile delivery process and take ownership for your team‚Äôs software quality from concept to production
  • Drive forward the production of reusable code and modules where appropriate with a view to maximising effort and reducing development costs by applying principles of Agile delivery


Your skills:


  • At least five years experience on Tableau or similar visualisation tools in complex business projects
  • Proven experience working with large, complex datasets in a cloud environment.
  • At least five years experience on SQL applied to enterprise grade projects
  • Extensive data analysis and interpretation background to critically evaluate data gathered from various sources, helping key partners understand and maximise the potential of data
  • Self-motivator with energy and drive for continuous improvement and a focus on delivering results
  • Proven ability to influence technical decisions in a fast-moving commercial environment
  • Demonstrates exceptional communication and social skills and has a demonstrable ability to influence technical decisions in a fast paced commercial environment
  • Attitude to act as a business translator to address with a faster pace analytic requirement, keeping high quality standards
  • Ability to 'think outside the box' to come up with pragmatic solutions to de-risks and solve issues
  • Ability to adapt to technological and business priority changes
  • Lean and/or Agile practice is appreciated
  • Data Governance principles knowledge is appreciated
  • Proven experience on cloud-based solutions is appreciated
  • Experience on Python, R or equivalent query languages will be a plus


If you‚Äôre ready to work in a dynamic environment alongside talented people who take pride in delivering great results, apply today.

Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate ‚Ç¨22.9bn revenue.

With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty‚Äôs, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Herm√®s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.

We‚Äôre hiring for a Data Science Analyst to join the Data & Business Intelligence team.
This role will support with the implementation of data science innovation projects that lead to an improvement in customer experience and economic value for the business and its partners.
Reporting to a Data Scientist, this role will support with the scale up and roll out of AI and big data led innovation projects.
As Data Science Analyst, you will:
Develop new Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning based products.
Collect and prepare data for various international projects.
Ensure data quality and consistency pre and post release.
Upgrade advanced analytical models while maintaining business continuity.
Scale analytical solutions from pilot to production for partner brands.
Provide support for advanced analytical solutions.
Experience as a Data Analyst or Data Science Analyst with a focus on big data and / or data science projects.
Knowledge of data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, SQL, and R.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, communication, and English language skills.
Experience working with dislocated teams in a global, multicultural environment.
Up to 35 days holiday and paid leave per year
Agile working model ‚Äì ability to work remotely 3 days per week.
Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Il presente annuncio √® rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le et√† e tutte le nazionalit√†, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

4130498632,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-subito-4130498632?position=22&pageNum=0&refId=qJtGlg75BmolBhpKoqD1nA%3D%3D&trackingId=%2Fxv%2BZWOJRx%2BtuA%2Flnd3v0w%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Subito,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.
The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.
The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding
4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences
Prior experience in a digital company
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
Hands on experience on Data Science projects
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You‚Äôll Do &
column2:
Who You Are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.

The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Your Typical Day

  • Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
  • Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
  • Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
  • Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
  • Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
  • Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding

Skills Required

  • 4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
  • Highly proficient with SQL
  • Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
  • Applied knowledge of statistical techniques
  • Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences

Plus

  • Good English proficiency level
  • Prior experience in a digital company
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
  • Hands on experience on Data Science projects

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
  • Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
  • Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • ‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Here at BizAway, we Deliver the Future of Travel. üòé

We are a solid international company with strong ambitions and great expertise. With a focus on sustainability üå±, on a daily basis we support companies enabling them to improve their travel management through our constantly evolving services and solutions, always characterized by our tech attitude and smart and innovative processes. üöÄ We know that success comes from People and deserves to be recognized.üë´Proactivity and

Reliability, Kind collaboration, and communication are the core values of our Solution Culture. If you like challenges and would love to be part of one of the fastest-growing B2B scale-ups, then BizAway is the company you have been looking for. ü§©
We are looking for a driven and enthusiastic Data Analyst (m/w/d) , who desires to contribute to the growth and success of our Product Team.
You manage and improve our current reporting system, supporting all internal needs for Data visualization of data findings through charts, graphs, and dashboards to make our data understandable.
You learn all aspects of the travel industry from Finance, Products, Sales and Service/Operations perspective, translating data into actionable insights resulting in verifiable reporting.
By having domain expertise in our industry, you engage with Business and Strategy stakeholders to help define KPIs, including how data will be captured, shared, and leveraged across our departments.
You contribute to creating the base foundations of a comprehensive source of truth through data modeling actions
Demonstrated experience with BI Data Visualization tools (Qlik preferred)
Data analysis, presentation, and visualization experience
Ability to work alone or in a team as required
Bachelor's degree in Computer science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field is preferred
Confidence in English (written and spoken level B2).
Experience with ETL tools (AWS Glue, Airflow, Talend)
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python

About BizAway

Here at BizAway, we Deliver the Future of Travel. üòé

We are a solid international company with strong ambitions and great expertise. With a focus on sustainability üå±, on a daily basis we support companies enabling them to improve their travel management through our constantly evolving services and solutions, always characterized by our tech attitude and smart and innovative processes. üöÄ We know that success comes from People and deserves to be recognized.üë´Proactivity and

Reliability, Kind collaboration, and communication are the core values of our Solution Culture. If you like challenges and would love to be part of one of the fastest-growing B2B scale-ups, then BizAway is the company you have been looking for. ü§©

We are looking for

We are looking for a driven and enthusiastic Data Analyst (m/w/d) , who desires to contribute to the growth and success of our Product Team.

Your role in BizAway

  • You manage and improve our current reporting system, supporting all internal needs for Data visualization of data findings through charts, graphs, and dashboards to make our data understandable.
  • You learn all aspects of the travel industry from Finance, Products, Sales and Service/Operations perspective, translating data into actionable insights resulting in verifiable reporting.
  • By having domain expertise in our industry, you engage with Business and Strategy stakeholders to help define KPIs, including how data will be captured, shared, and leveraged across our departments.
  • You contribute to creating the base foundations of a comprehensive source of truth through data modeling actions

Your Basic Qualifications

  • Demonstrated experience with BI Data Visualization tools (Qlik preferred)
  • Data analysis, presentation, and visualization experience
  • Strong communication skills required
  • Ability to work alone or in a team as required
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field is preferred
  • Confidence in English (written and spoken level B2).

We are also interested in

  • Experience with ETL tools (AWS Glue, Airflow, Talend)
  • Understanding of machine learning concepts
  • Knowledge of programming languages such as Python

Siamo alla ricerca di talenti da inserire come Data Analyst all'interno del dipartimento Online Sales.

In questo ruolo avrai il compito di analizzare l‚Äôintera journey di vendita del cliente che avviene attraverso tutte le properties digitali (sito, App, aggregatori, customer care, partnership), dalla prima interazione al rinnovo. Dovrai mappare le dinamiche e le abitudini degli utenti nei vari touchpoint con Prima, al fine di migliorare le performance degli attuali canali di vendita, nonch√© di migliorare il valore generato da ciascun cliente. Il tuo lavoro influir√† direttamente sulla strategia di vendita diretta e i risultati economici dell‚Äôazienda, una chiave fondamentale per la crescita e la sostenibilit√† di Prima.
Nello Specifico, Sarai Responsabile Di Queste Attivit√†
Impostare sistema di analisi per attivit√† in termini di risultati e performance con estrazioni da DB
Creare modelli analitici di monitoraggio utilizzando Tableau e Python per supportare le decisione strategiche del team
Collaborare, supportare e comunicare con i vari stakeholders dati e risultati inerenti alle attivit√† del canale di vendita online
Analizzare le performance di vendita per canale, tipologia di prodotto e cliente, al fine di individuare opportunit√† di crescita e di eliminare possibili frizioni all‚Äôacquisto
Ottimizzare la journey del cliente, analizzando le diverse interazioni lungo tutti i touchpoint con il cliente, al fine di migliorare massimizzare i KPI di vendita
Implementare modelli di attribuzione per isolare e misurare l‚Äôimpatto delle varie iniziative online
Analizzare l'impatto atteso da nuove iniziative/prodotti, supportando la costruzione dei relativi business case.
Buona conoscenza nella creazione di dataset utilizzando linguaggi per l‚Äôestrazione di dati (MySQL, Redshift, PostgreSQL)
Capacit√† di fare analisi e creare modelli utilizzando Python, Tableau e Excel
Proattivit√† e voglia di mettersi in gioco, all‚Äôinterno di un team nuovo, dinamico e trasversale
Capacit√† logiche e analitiche: padroneggi velocemente argomenti molto complessi e riesci a modellizzarne le dinamiche e i rapporti causa-effetto.
Curiosit√† e passione: hai uno sguardo critico e ti chiedi sempre come puoi migliorare le cose. Sei attratto dalle nuove tecnologie e da tutte le tematiche che abbracciano l‚Äôinnovazione.

Elasticit√† ed attitudine al cambiamento: reagisci positivamente ai cambiamenti, accettando le sfide continue che incontri. Sei elastico e ben predisposto a lavorare con persone dal background e forma mentis diversi dai tuoi.
Oltre ai requisiti di base, valuteremo con particolare attenzione queste caratteristiche:
Hai avuto esperienze internazionali (e.g. erasmus, stage) e parli inglese fluentemente
Sai usare almeno un software di Business Intelligence e data visualization (e.g. Tableau).
1-2 anni di esperienza pregressa in societ√† di analisi dei dati, consulenza o simili ( nice to have)
Hai solide basi di statistica inferenziale, probabilit√†, modellizzazione matematica, algoritmi statistici e tecniche di machine learning
Sai programmare in Python (e/o R) e conosci le principali librerie di analisi dati (e.g. Pandas, NumPy, SciPy)

Prima √® una comunit√† composta da individui talentuosi e ambiziosi. Offriamo pari opportunit√† di impiego e siamo orientati verso la diversit√† e l'inclusione sul luogo di lavoro. Vietiamo qualsiasi forma di discriminazione basata su razza, colore, genere, religione, orientamento sessuale, nazionalit√†, disabilit√†, informazioni genetiche, gravidanza o altre caratteristiche personali protette, come definite dalle leggi nazionali.

4129176393,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/network-data-scientist-at-sky-italia-4129176393?position=37&pageNum=0&refId=qJtGlg75BmolBhpKoqD1nA%3D%3D&trackingId=To1QObfmKheCf58Ejkxe0A%3D%3D,Network Data Scientist,Sky Italia,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","What you'll do:

You will work in a team of Network Planners, Developers and Data Scientists to support the development of modelling and analytics capabilities for planning Sky‚Äôs Mobile and Voice network infrastructure and to drive the network strategy.
This is a highly dynamic role that will allow you to grow multidisciplinary skills in the Data Science, Network Modelling and Cloud Development domains.
Ingest and process network and commercial data
Create regular and ad hoc reports
Communicate requirements to the software team
Identify network capacity limits and network metrics
Create capacity and economic network models
Apply data science methodologies to analyse and improve network performance and cost efficiency
Develop Insights to support commercial objectives and present analysis/plans to relevant stakeholders up to UK CTO
You will have good knowledge and experience (gained in the industry) in the data science area. Alternatively, you have industry network experience combined with good exposure to data analytics.
BSc in Maths, Statistics, Data Science (or similar)
Proven experience with managing and analysing time series data
Hands on programming skills in Python and SQL
PhD in Computer Science or similar
Familiarity with large packet core and mobile networks
Working experience deploying solutions on public cloud

The Network Software and Data Science team, part of Sky‚Äôs Engineering Division, takes a data-driven approach towards meeting network planning goals, including capacity planning, performance planning and network economics. We develop insights which reinforce planning decisions and support wider commercial objectives.

What you'll do:

You will work in a team of Network Planners, Developers and Data Scientists to support the development of modelling and analytics capabilities for planning Sky‚Äôs Mobile and Voice network infrastructure and to drive the network strategy.


This is a highly dynamic role that will allow you to grow multidisciplinary skills in the Data Science, Network Modelling and Cloud Development domains.


Your main responsibilities will be:


Data Engineering and Analysis

Ingest and process network and commercial data

Create regular and ad hoc reports

Communicate requirements to the software team

Network Modelling

Identify network capacity limits and network metrics

Create capacity and economic network models

Generate capacity and budget forecasts

Network Analytics

Apply data science methodologies to analyse and improve network performance and cost efficiency

Develop Insights to support commercial objectives and present analysis/plans to relevant stakeholders up to UK CTO


What you'll bring:

You will have good knowledge and experience (gained in the industry) in the data science area. Alternatively, you have industry network experience combined with good exposure to data analytics.

Essential requirements:

BSc in Maths, Statistics, Data Science (or similar)

Proven experience with managing and analysing time series data

Hands on programming skills in Python and SQL

Familiarity with Agile methodologies

Excellent presentation skills

Stakeholder management experience

Desirable requirements

PhD in Computer Science or similar

Experience capacity panning virtual appliances

Familiarity with large packet core and mobile networks

Working experience deploying solutions on public cloud


Team Overview:

The Network Software and Data Science team, part of Sky‚Äôs Engineering Division, takes a data-driven approach towards meeting network planning goals, including capacity planning, performance planning and network economics. We develop insights which reinforce planning decisions and support wider commercial objectives.

  • Analizzare e presentare i dati editoriali relativi ai nostri contenuti digitali e podcast in modo che siano interpretabili ed azionabili
  • Dare indicazioni sulle performance di progetti speciali o iniziative in partnership con aziende terze
  • Aggiornare la reportistica interna che guida i diversi team nel capire cosa funziona e cosa no! Ci aiuterai ad identificare le diverse opportunit√†.
  • Elaborare previsioni e stime sulla base del nostro storico
  • Gestione e manutenzione dei dati real time, automazione di quelli non disponibili
  • Creazione e ottimizzazione di dashboard con diversi tool/strumenti/source per monitorare KPI chiave
  • Condividere i dati chiaramente con team abituati - e non - al ragionamento numerico.
column7:
• Elaborazione di informazioni quantitative per i progetti strategici o nuovi lanci sul mercato.


    • Cosa ci aspettiamo da te:

    • Almeno 2-3 anni di esperienza come Data Analyst, preferibilmente in ambito digitale o editoriale.
    • Forti competenze quantitative di analisi e pensiero critico
column8:
• Esperienza nella gestione di dati relativi ad audience, traffico web o performance dei contenuti e nell‚Äôanalisi del comportamento degli utenti sul web.
  • Conoscenza avanzata di strumenti come Excel, SQL e software di visualizzazione (es. Tableau, Power BI, LookerStudio, Google Data Studio).
  • Familiarit√† con i principali tool di web analytics (es. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics).
  • Ottime capacit√† interpersonali e di comunicazione, sai relazionarti bene con stakeholder diversi
  • Passione per i contenuti digitali e per il mondo del giornalismo/podcasting
  • Utilizzi tool di AI quotidianamente per il tuo lavoro
  • Nice to have: conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione
column9:
• Forte senso di responsabilit√†
  • Ti piace il tuo lavoro e sai come farlo al meglio
  • Hai voglia di crescere, di imparare e di sporcarti le mani
  • Ti ritrovi nei nostri valori: https://willmedia.it/come-lo-facciamo/


    • Cosa proponiamo

    • Contratto CCNL commercio
    • RAL fra i 38.000 e i 45.000 euro in base alla tua esperienza + buoni pasto
    • Possibilit√† di smartworking
    • Una realt√† media nuova e dinamica che vuole raccontare il cambiamento nel mondo (ma non solo) in modo innovativo
    • Un team giovane, inclusivo ed informale, innamorato del proprio lavoro e che ha voglia di fare la differenza
    • Se saprai sfruttarle, ampie opportunit√† di crescita individuale e di team, vogliamo valorizzare tutte le persone che fanno parte di Will e Chora
    • Sei sedute di psicoterapia con Serenis
    • Eventi, aperitivi e team building. Ci piace lavorare ma anche stare insieme o festeggiare i risultati raggiunti!

At TrueLayer, we‚Äôre building the future of payments. We‚Äôre on a mission to take on outdated payment methods with a solution designed for today‚Äôs online, on-demand economy. By removing friction at the heart of commerce ‚Äî the payment ‚Äî we‚Äôre making it faster, safer, and smarter for everyone.

To date, we‚Äôve raised $300 million from world-renowned investors including Stripe, Tiger Global, Addition, and Tencent. With offices in London, Milan, and Dublin, we‚Äôre trusted by industry leaders like RyanAir and JustEat Takeaway. But this is just the beginning.

We‚Äôre reimagining how the world pays, invests, shops, and saves. We‚Äôre transforming payments for industries like e-Commerce and iGaming, redefining what‚Äôs possible with technology and innovation. Now, we‚Äôre looking for people who are ready to help us build a brand that changes an industry.
TrueLayer's new Analytics team empowers our entire organisation to make strategic decisions based on a scalable data infrastructure, coupled with commercial insight and impeccable leadership skills.

A Data Analyst at TrueLayer works in cross-functional teams and partners with stakeholders across the company, including Growth, Client Care, Engineering and Product, to unlock the power of data and drive strategic decision-making. You‚Äôll spend your time building datasets, conducting analysis and sharing learnings with teams.

In return, we‚Äôll empower our Data Analysts to own Analytics planning, and make key decisions around data infrastructure and analytics best practices. Working in an exciting and growing team of Analysts, Data Engineers and an Analytics Lead, your analysis and insight will be the fuel that drives our journey to power the new era of financial innovation globally.
What we expect from you as a Data Analyst:
Collaborate with business teams such as Commercial, Product, Client Care, Engineering and Operations to understand and help define their analytics requirements
Build and maintain data models for key business use cases, through DBT
Drive the collection and integration of new and existing data sources
Be a BI subject matter expert, conduct deep analyses and communicate insights to the business
Help cultivate a data-driven culture by providing TrueLayeristas with the knowledge and tools required to self-serve
Relevant experience that aligns with the key requirements of the role, demonstrating a proven ability to contribute effectively and drive results.
Experience in using Git for end-to-end deployment in production workloads
Experience working with cloud platforms, such as AWS or GCP
Experience with data orchestration tools, such as Apache Airflow or AWS Step Functions
Proficiency in SQL for data modelling
Experience with data visualisation, and familiarity with self-serve tools such as QuickSight, Looker or Tableau
Familiarity with business metrics such as conversion rates, CAC, CSAT, LTV, MRR and experience working with business teams to define and maintain KPIs
The ability to communicate effectively, simply, and clearly - you can present insights to technical and non-technical audiences, and you love proposing actionable solutions
Self-sufficiency, the ability to motivate yourself and manage your own priorities and time
A passion for bringing fresh ideas to the table, and drive things forward without needing direction
We'd be particularly excited if you have
Experience using DBT (cloud or core) for data modelling in production workflows
Previous experience at a startup or high-growth company in FinTech or Payments
Working knowledge of machine learning methodology and algorithms (including Python packages)
What you can expect from us:
Competitive salary and meaningful equity in the company üí∞
Flexible hours and very flexible hybrid/remote working within Italy
A one-off contribution of ‚Ç¨200 to help you set up your home office üí∫
Flexible holiday policy, with 24 days as standard ‚úàÔ∏è
2 volunteering days to support causes important to you üå≥
Generous parental leave, above and beyond statutory requirements and with no minimum tenure üë©‚Äçüë©‚Äçüë¶
Meal vouchers for every day you‚Äôre working, including while remote [IT Roles Only]
Budget to spend on learning & development each year üìö
12 fully-paid wellbeing days a year and your birthday off (on top of the holiday allowance) üïä
Membership of mental wellbeing platform Spill üßò

At TrueLayer, we don‚Äôt just do inclusion and diversity. We embrace people that have different opinions, perspectives and personalities. Because we believe that by seeing the world from all sorts of angles, we can make life better for all the people who live in it. We strongly encourage applications from underrepresented groups (e.g. people of colour, the LGBTQ+ community, people with disabilities, neurodivergent people, parents, carers, and people from all socio-economic backgrounds). If you‚Äôd like to discuss alternative working patterns, please let us know.

We will always aim to make appropriate adjustments to ensure we are fully inclusive to people with different needs during our interview process. So if you need us to make any adjustments to suit your individual needs please let us know - we‚Äôll be happy to support you.

At TrueLayer, we‚Äôre building the future of payments. We‚Äôre on a mission to take on outdated payment methods with a solution designed for today‚Äôs online, on-demand economy. 4027598112,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-capabilities-insights-analyst-at-mckinsey-company-4027598112?position=57&pageNum=0&refId=qJtGlg75BmolBhpKoqD1nA%3D%3D&trackingId=Wt%2BiBUma9cN22E4hovAujw%3D%3D,Junior Capabilities & Insights Analyst,McKinsey & Company,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Who You'll Work With
You will be based in our Milan office as part of Milan Client Capability Network team.

The Milan Client Capabilities Network is part of the geographic research and knowledge group with analysts covering the main sectors of activity for McKinsey in Italy. The Client Capabilities Network is a global network, which includes more than 7000 research and knowledge professionals who work alongside our consultants and clients to generate distinctive insights and proprietary knowledge.

When you join McKinsey, you will be part of global community of colleagues with diverse backgrounds and expertise who are all working to create positive, sustainable and inclusive growth. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.

You will support consultants and clients developing capabilities to gain insights to solve specific client business problems, and will leverage your experience in research to be a thought-partner to teams and clients.

In this role, you will prioritize research activities to make a change that matters. You will develop with time industry knowledge and expertise in the Technology, Media & Telecommunications / Digital sector. You‚Äôll also collaborate with our global research team to share and build knowledge, best practices and relevant new ideas. You will develop knowledge and help support the continuous improvement of our knowledge assets, innovating firm knowledge and delivery through special projects, both with client teams and on a stand-alone basis.
The type of contract and the level of role will depend on your experience and qualifications.
Master's degree in economics or business engineering with record of strong academic achievement
Interest in Technology, Media & Telecommunications or Digital
Up to 1 year of post-graduate work experience
column2: recent graduates with relevant internship experience will be considered

We are Stone Island


Stone Island is a defiantly independent community. Since our founding in 1982, a shared mindset has driven us to become a globally recognised icon of independent spirit, leadership, and innovation. The Stone Island spirit is the foundation of the culture that we cherish and nurture every day. We provide you with the opportunity to build relationships that will shape your career, your life and our famiglia. The opportunity to follow your own compass.


The Role: Digital Analyst Intern

At Stone Island we are always looking for people who share our spirit and values to drive our company forward. We are currently looking for an engaged and passionate Digital Analyst Intern who can join the Digital Team at the Stone Island HQ in Milan.

As a Digital Analyst Intern, you will play a crucial role in supporting the Digital Team. The ideal candidate will be fluent in both English and Italian, possess a strong interest in Digital area, and have a keen eye for detail. We are seeking someone who is passionate about fashion and numerical challenges.


The position will provide strategic and operational support to the Digital Team fostering a culture of simplification, innovation and collaboration.


The Day-To-Day:

  • Support the yearly Sales Forecasts and Planning through analysis of key trends and sales drivers
  • Build and interpret business, sales and merchandising analysis on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis
  • Website Core vitals and purchase funnel monitor
  • Home page and category page performance tracking, to proactively provide insights on how improve client engagement towards digital content and user journey
  • Monitor for all lines and categories the in-season performance against financial targets, leveraging on omnichannel stock rebalancing opportunities, across all regions
  • Client profile analysis


Key Qualifications:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Economics or related field
  • Advanced computer skills in Excel is mandatory
  • A precise, positive, and adaptable attitude


Our Shared Values

At Stone Island we aren‚Äôt led by conventions or trends, but by our own compass. Shared values we put into practice everyday to maintain our unique culture of relentless innovation.


SELF RELIANCE | SOLIDARITY | ENGINEERING MINDSET | MATERIAL OBSESSION


If you are ready to follow your compass with Stone Island, apply now!

At TrueLayer, we‚Äôre building the future of payments. We‚Äôre on a mission to take on outdated payment methods with a solution designed for today‚Äôs online, on-demand economy. By removing friction at the heart of commerce ‚Äî the payment ‚Äî we‚Äôre making it faster, safer, and smarter for everyone.

To date, we‚Äôve raised $300 million from world-renowned investors including Stripe, Tiger Global, Addition, and Tencent. With offices in London, Milan, and Dublin, we‚Äôre trusted by industry leaders like RyanAir and JustEat Takeaway. But this is just the beginning.

We‚Äôre reimagining how the world pays, invests, shops, and saves. We‚Äôre transforming payments for industries like e-Commerce and iGaming, redefining what‚Äôs possible with technology and innovation. Now, we‚Äôre looking for people who are ready to help us build a brand that changes an industry.
TrueLayer's new Analytics team empowers our entire organisation to make strategic decisions based on a scalable data infrastructure, coupled with commercial insight and impeccable leadership skills.

A Data Analyst at TrueLayer works in cross-functional teams and partners with stakeholders across the company, including Growth, Client Care, Engineering and Product, to unlock the power of data and drive strategic decision-making. You‚Äôll spend your time building datasets, conducting analysis and sharing learnings with teams.

In return, we‚Äôll empower our Data Analysts to own Analytics planning, and make key decisions around data infrastructure and analytics best practices. Working in an exciting and growing team of Analysts, Data Engineers and an Analytics Lead, your analysis and insight will be the fuel that drives our journey to power the new era of financial innovation globally.
What we expect from you as a Data Analyst:
Collaborate with business teams such as Commercial, Product, Client Care, Engineering and Operations to understand and help define their analytics requirements
Build and maintain data models for key business use cases, through DBT
Drive the collection and integration of new and existing data sources
Be a BI subject matter expert, conduct deep analyses and communicate insights to the business
Help cultivate a data-driven culture by providing TrueLayeristas with the knowledge and tools required to self-serve
Relevant experience that aligns with the key requirements of the role, demonstrating a proven ability to contribute effectively and drive results.
Experience in using Git for end-to-end deployment in production workloads
Experience working with cloud platforms, such as AWS or GCP
Experience with data orchestration tools, such as Apache Airflow or AWS Step Functions
Proficiency in SQL for data modelling
Experience with data visualisation, and familiarity with self-serve tools such as QuickSight, Looker or Tableau
Familiarity with business metrics such as conversion rates, CAC, CSAT, LTV, MRR and experience working with business teams to define and maintain KPIs
The ability to communicate effectively, simply, and clearly - you can present insights to technical and non-technical audiences, and you love proposing actionable solutions
Self-sufficiency, the ability to motivate yourself and manage your own priorities and time
A passion for bringing fresh ideas to the table, and drive things forward without needing direction
We'd be particularly excited if you have
Experience using DBT (cloud or core) for data modelling in production workflows
Previous experience at a startup or high-growth company in FinTech or Payments
Working knowledge of machine learning methodology and algorithms (including Python packages)
What you can expect from us:
Competitive salary and meaningful equity in the company üí∞
Flexible hours and very flexible hybrid/remote working within Italy
A one-off contribution of ‚Ç¨200 to help you set up your home office üí∫
Flexible holiday policy, with 24 days as standard ‚úàÔ∏è
2 volunteering days to support causes important to you üå≥
Generous parental leave, above and beyond statutory requirements and with no minimum tenure üë©‚Äçüë©‚Äçüë¶
Meal vouchers for every day you‚Äôre working, including while remote [IT Roles Only]
Budget to spend on learning & development each year üìö
12 fully-paid wellbeing days a year and your birthday off (on top of the holiday allowance) üïä
Membership of mental wellbeing platform Spill üßò

At TrueLayer, we don‚Äôt just do inclusion and diversity. We embrace people that have different opinions, perspectives and personalities. Because we believe that by seeing the world from all sorts of angles, we can make life better for all the people who live in it. We strongly encourage applications from underrepresented groups (e.g. people of colour, the LGBTQ+ community, people with disabilities, neurodivergent people, parents, carers, and people from all socio-economic backgrounds). If you‚Äôd like to discuss alternative working patterns, please let us know.

We will always aim to make appropriate adjustments to ensure we are fully inclusive to people with different needs during our interview process. So if you need us to make any adjustments to suit your individual needs please let us know - we‚Äôll be happy to support you.

Who we are:

At TrueLayer, we‚Äôre building the future of payments. We‚Äôre on a mission to take on outdated payment methods with a solution designed for today‚Äôs online, on-demand economy. By removing friction at the heart of commerce ‚Äî the payment ‚Äî we‚Äôre making it faster, safer, and smarter for everyone.

To date, we‚Äôve raised $300 million from world-renowned investors including Stripe, Tiger Global, Addition, and Tencent. With offices in London, Milan, and Dublin, we‚Äôre trusted by industry leaders like RyanAir and JustEat Takeaway. But this is just the beginning.

We‚Äôre reimagining how the world pays, invests, shops, and saves. We‚Äôre transforming payments for industries like e-Commerce and iGaming, redefining what‚Äôs possible with technology and innovation. Now, we‚Äôre looking for people who are ready to help us build a brand that changes an industry.

Description

TrueLayer's new Analytics team empowers our entire organisation to make strategic decisions based on a scalable data infrastructure, coupled with commercial insight and impeccable leadership skills.

A Data Analyst at TrueLayer works in cross-functional teams and partners with stakeholders across the company, including Growth, Client Care, Engineering and Product, to unlock the power of data and drive strategic decision-making. You‚Äôll spend your time building datasets, conducting analysis and sharing learnings with teams.

In return, we‚Äôll empower our Data Analysts to own Analytics planning, and make key decisions around data infrastructure and analytics best practices. Working in an exciting and growing team of Analysts, Data Engineers and an Analytics Lead, your analysis and insight will be the fuel that drives our journey to power the new era of financial innovation globally.

What we expect from you as a Data Analyst:

  • Collaborate with business teams such as Commercial, Product, Client Care, Engineering and Operations to understand and help define their analytics requirements
  • Build and maintain data models for key business use cases, through DBT
  • Drive the collection and integration of new and existing data sources
  • Be a BI subject matter expert, conduct deep analyses and communicate insights to the business
  • Help cultivate a data-driven culture by providing TrueLayeristas with the knowledge and tools required to self-serve


Who You Are

  • Relevant experience that aligns with the key requirements of the role, demonstrating a proven ability to contribute effectively and drive results.
  • Experience in using Git for end-to-end deployment in production workloads
  • Experience working with cloud platforms, such as AWS or GCP
  • Experience with data orchestration tools, such as Apache Airflow or AWS Step Functions
  • Proficiency in SQL for data modelling
  • Experience with data visualisation, and familiarity with self-serve tools such as QuickSight, Looker or Tableau
  • Familiarity with business metrics such as conversion rates, CAC, CSAT, LTV, MRR and experience working with business teams to define and maintain KPIs
  • The ability to communicate effectively, simply, and clearly - you can present insights to technical and non-technical audiences, and you love proposing actionable solutions
  • Self-sufficiency, the ability to motivate yourself and manage your own priorities and time
  • A passion for bringing fresh ideas to the table, and drive things forward without needing direction


We'd be particularly excited if you have

  • Experience using DBT (cloud or core) for data modelling in production workflows
  • Previous experience at a startup or high-growth company in FinTech or Payments
  • Working knowledge of machine learning methodology and algorithms (including Python packages)


Benefits

What you can expect from us:

  • Competitive salary and meaningful equity in the company üí∞
  • Flexible hours and very flexible hybrid/remote working within Italy
  • A one-off contribution of ‚Ç¨200 to help you set up your home office üí∫
  • Flexible holiday policy, with 24 days as standard ‚úàÔ∏è
  • 2 volunteering days to support causes important to you üå≥
  • Generous parental leave, above and beyond statutory requirements and with no minimum tenure üë©‚Äçüë©‚Äçüë¶
  • Meal vouchers for every day you‚Äôre working, including while remote [IT Roles Only]
  • Budget to spend on learning &
column2:
development each year üìö
  • 12 fully-paid wellbeing days a year and your birthday off (on top of the holiday allowance) üïä
  • Membership of mental wellbeing platform Spill üßò

Because we believe that by seeing the world from all sorts of angles, we can make life better for all the people who live in it. Will √® una community online di persone e aziende consapevoli del loro impatto sul futuro.¬†
Ogni giorno raccontiamo l‚Äôattualit√† attraverso contenuti originali ed una grande variet√† di format, distribuiti attraverso le nostre otto piattaforme, eventi live, progetti speciali.¬†
Ci impegniamo a farlo con semplicit√† e chiarezza, ma mai banalit√†.

Chora si rivolge a chi √® in cerca di una prospettiva pi√π ricca sul mondo, dando voce a una vasta gamma di narrative autentiche, attraverso podcast che spesso si evolvono in altre forme (video, libri, eventi online e offline).
Insieme rappresentano un punto di riferimento in Italia per il giornalismo digitale e il podcasting.¬†
Siamo alla ricerca di un/una Data Analyst che entri a far parte del nostro team editoriale.¬†
Uno dei nostri mantra √® ‚Äúnon ci sono dogmi, ma solo tesi supportate dai dati‚Äù.
Il tuo lavoro sar√† fondamentale per supportare e ispirare le scelte editoriali e migliorare l‚Äôefficacia dei nostri contenuti.

Ci aspettiamo quindi che tu sia appassionato del mondo digitale ed editoriale ed abbia desiderio di sperimentare e testare tante soluzioni diverse,¬†analizzarne i dati e condividerli internamente con chiarezza ed efficacia.
Riporterai all‚Äôhead of Content e lavorerai all‚Äôinterno del team editoriale.
Ti interfaccerai anche con il Responsabile delle piattaforme social, con il nostro Chief of Marketing e con il team partnership e sales per alcune iniziative speciali.
Analizzare e presentare i dati editoriali relativi ai nostri contenuti digitali e podcast in modo che siano interpretabili ed azionabili
Dare indicazioni sulle performance di progetti speciali o iniziative in partnership con aziende terze
Aggiornare la reportistica interna che guida i diversi team nel capire cosa funziona e cosa no! Ci aiuterai ad identificare le diverse opportunit√†.
Elaborare previsioni e stime sulla base del nostro storico
Gestione e manutenzione dei dati real time, automazione di quelli non disponibili
Creazione e ottimizzazione di dashboard con diversi tool/strumenti/source per monitorare KPI chiave
Condividere i dati chiaramente con team abituati - e non - al ragionamento numerico.¬†
Elaborazione di informazioni quantitative per i progetti strategici o nuovi lanci sul mercato.
Almeno 2-3 anni di esperienza come Data Analyst, preferibilmente in ambito digitale o editoriale.
Forti competenze quantitative di analisi e pensiero critico¬†
Esperienza nella gestione di dati relativi ad audience, traffico web o performance dei contenuti e nell‚Äôanalisi del comportamento degli utenti sul web.
Conoscenza avanzata di strumenti come Excel, SQL e software di visualizzazione (es. Tableau, Power BI, LookerStudio, Google Data Studio).
Familiarit√† con i principali tool di web analytics (es. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics).
Ottime capacit√† interpersonali e di comunicazione, sai relazionarti bene con stakeholder diversi
Passione per i contenuti digitali e per il mondo del giornalismo/podcasting
Utilizzi tool di AI quotidianamente per il tuo lavoro
Nice to have: conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione¬†
Ti piace il tuo lavoro e sai come farlo al meglio
Hai voglia di crescere, di imparare e di sporcarti le mani
Ti ritrovi nei nostri valori: https://willmedia.it/come-lo-facciamo/
RAL fra i 38.000 e i 45.000 euro in base alla tua esperienza + buoni pasto
Una realt√† media nuova e dinamica che vuole raccontare il cambiamento nel mondo (ma non solo) in modo innovativo
Un team giovane, inclusivo ed informale, innamorato del proprio lavoro e che ha voglia di fare la differenza
Se saprai sfruttarle, ampie opportunit√† di crescita individuale e di team, vogliamo valorizzare tutte le persone che fanno parte di Will e Chora
Sei sedute di psicoterapia con Serenis
Eventi, aperitivi e team building. Ci piace lavorare ma anche stare insieme o festeggiare i risultati raggiunti!

4092104731,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-power-bi-at-laco-4092104731?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=HsMMwMJ4fCkzZHzDEm143Q%3D%3D&trackingId=cawluNUZHdnvqv0Cu6TQkA%3D%3D,Data Analyst / Power BI,LACO,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.

LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.

At LACO, we value long-term relationships with both our clients and colleagues. We have recently secured several large projects with key clients, and to support these, we are looking to strengthen our Microsoft team to deliver end-to-end projects alongside the LACO team.
As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you‚Äôll be responsible for:
Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.
You have a Bachelor‚Äôs and/or Master‚Äôs degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.
You get even more bonus points if ‚Ä¶
You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.

We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.


LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data &
column2:
AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.


At LACO, we value long-term relationships with both our clients and colleagues. We have recently secured several large projects with key clients, and to support these, we are looking to strengthen our Microsoft team to deliver end-to-end projects alongside the LACO team.


YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you‚Äôll be responsible for:

  • Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
  • Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
  • Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
  • Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
  • Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
  • Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
  • Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.


YOUR SKILLS

  • You have a Bachelor‚Äôs and/or Master‚Äôs degree in computer science or equivalent.
  • You have an analytical mindset.
  • You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
  • You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
  • You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
  • You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.


You get even more bonus points if ‚Ä¶

  • You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
  • You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
  • You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.


OUR OFFER

  • We‚Äôre open to work with Employees and Freelancers
  • Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
  • Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
  • Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
  • A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, ‚Ä¶


Don‚Äôt let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.
