4125890441,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/customer-data-analyst-at-lastminute-com-4125890441?position=2&pageNum=0&refId=4qAXL%2B7wAIvsbw5jzimTIQ%3D%3D&trackingId=RQ3UkL3%2F0xGctHATo6zaGw%3D%3D,Customer Data Analyst,lastminute.com,"Chiasso, Ticino, Switzerland","At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.

We are looking for a Customer Data Analyst to join our team of around 1,700 people worldwide to help us power up the traveler's journey for millions of holidaymakers. If you are passionate about solving complex problems and skilled at analyzing big data sets, keep on reading, as you might be the perfect fit for this job.

The candidate will have the opportunity to become a key member of the team leveraging the analytical skills to produce actionable insights and improve customer experience. Specifically, the analyst will have the chance to work on customer centric analysis and cross domain projects (Loyalty, CRM & Marketing, Login, Consents, APP, etc.).
Team - you will join the Data Analytics team within the Technology department.
Level - Professional (working in teams or individually on projects, with emphasis on technical/discipline knowledge rather than managing people)
Data extraction, analysis and reporting, in order to drive performance insights and support business decisions
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns to optimise business performance
Works closely with internal stakeholders in order to identify and prioritise business needs and opportunities
Explores and proactively propose new product and business opportunities
Communicates and presents results, insights and recommendations to all levels of the company, clearly and concisely
Cooperate with other Data Analysts across the company on joint projects, to identify and exploit synergies and to preserve/improve governance on data and on business knowledge
Closely partner with Data Engineers to identify data needs and support the data quality of the deliverables
At least 2 years of experience in a similar role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Excel.
Good knowledge of data visualization tools like Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Power BI.
Ability to influence decision makers through presentations of analysis
Familiarity with digital and ecommerce business
Previous experience in the travel industry
Experience in building pipelines and data models
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you‚Äôll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.

- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O‚Äôreilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.) in line with local laws.
Wish you were here? We do, too!
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)
Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.
Please submit your resume in English
Please submit your resume in English

At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.

We are looking for a Customer Data Analyst to join our team of around 1,700 people worldwide to help us power up the traveler's journey for millions of holidaymakers. If you are passionate about solving complex problems and skilled at analyzing big data sets, keep on reading, as you might be the perfect fit for this job.

The candidate will have the opportunity to become a key member of the team leveraging the analytical skills to produce actionable insights and improve customer experience. Specifically, the analyst will have the chance to work on customer centric analysis and cross domain projects (Loyalty, CRM &
column2:
Marketing, Login, Consents, APP, etc.).



Job Description

Job Title - Customer Data Analyst

Working model - Chiasso hybrid

Team - you will join the Data Analytics team within the Technology department.

Level - Professional (working in teams or individually on projects, with emphasis on technical/discipline knowledge rather than managing people)

Location - Chiasso

Contract - Permanent - full-time (EUR 36 h/week)



What your impact will be

  • Data extraction, analysis and reporting, in order to drive performance insights and support business decisions
  • Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns to optimise business performance
  • Works closely with internal stakeholders in order to identify and prioritise business needs and opportunities
  • Explores and proactively propose new product and business opportunities
  • Communicates and presents results, insights and recommendations to all levels of the company, clearly and concisely
  • Cooperate with other Data Analysts across the company on joint projects, to identify and exploit synergies and to preserve/improve governance on data and on business knowledge
  • Closely partner with Data Engineers to identify data needs and support the data quality of the deliverables

Qualifications

Your expertise:

  • At least 2 years of experience in a similar role
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and Excel.
  • Good knowledge of data visualization tools like Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Power BI.
  • Proficiency in English.



Desirable:

  • Python
  • Ability to influence decision makers through presentations of analysis
  • Familiarity with digital and ecommerce business
  • Previous experience in the travel industry
  • Experience in building pipelines and data models

Additional Information

How we work together:
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you‚Äôll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations

How we learn together:
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.
- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O‚Äôreilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content

Other perks:
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.) in line with local laws.


Wish you were here? We do, too!



Selection process steps*:

  • HR interview (10-30 minutes)
  • Offline Tech test
  • 1st interview (Manager): with test review
  • 2nd interview (Manager + team member):
  • Decision making &
column3:
Offer extended
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)



Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.

Eligibility criteria:
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.

Problem solving: Abilit√† nel risolvere problemi complessi in modo strutturato ed efficiente.
Conoscenze finanziarie: Comprensione di concetti finanziari di base.
Disponibilit√†: Pronto a unirti al team subito.
Formazione: Laurea in Economia, Finanza o Amministrazione (preferibile).

Ambiente dinamico: Lavorerai in un contesto giovane e collaborativo.
Visibilit√† diretta: Lavorerai a stretto contatto con i manager e il country manager.
Contratto: Iniziale cococo di 9 mesi, con possibilit√† di rinnovo.
Retribuzione: Stipendio fisso di ‚Ç¨1.413 lordi al mese, con bonus mensili legati alle performance.
Benefit: Buoni pasto fino a ‚Ç¨92 al mese.
Formazione: Un percorso di formazione iniziale e affiancamento continuo.
Orario: Full-time, con presenza in ufficio a Roma (zona Flaminio).

4073743823,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/energy-data-analyst-at-aurora-energy-research-4073743823?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=KW7dU5BcEu2SoSIdYvmJ4g%3D%3D&trackingId=%2BZSsxmf0X%2FUzJGYmxmpvGQ%3D%3D,Energy Data Analyst,Aurora Energy Research,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Department: Research

Joining our Rome Research team, you will play an active role in delivering Aurora's Italian power market forecasts, energy policy analysis and client facing services. In particular, the Analyst will help the development of an Italian power grid model, becoming the expert on grid-related issues for the Italian market. In doing so, you will help to guide utilities, investors, and government through the fundamental transition European power markets are facing.

The successful applicant will combine strong quantitative ability with a track record of performance in team-oriented environments. You will work in a dynamic, intellectually stimulating, and demanding yet supportive environment. You will enjoy autonomy, the opportunity to substantially influence major decisions in the energy sector, and to grow into an industry expert under the guidance of directors with deep experience addressing major strategic issues at the world's leading advisory firms.

The position suits a candidate with 1-2 years of work experience, preferably in positions related to power market modelling. Exact entry position will be dependent on experience and educational level.
We are looking for the candidate to begin the role by March 2025
Carry out quantitative analysis to deliver our power market forecasts and related analysis
Support the development of a grid model for the Italian power system, working closely with our modelling team
Monitor market activity, keeping up to date on the latest market developments
Deliver both online and in-person presentations and workshops to a broad range of client
Work closely with our modelling team, structuring economic problems into quantifiable analyses and deriving insights from the model results
Contribute to Aurora's product development, by identifying new opportunities and expanding our capabilities
Contribute to the expansion of Aurora's research topics and analytical tools
Master's degree in a quantitative subject (e.g. Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Finance)
1-2 years' experience in quantitative analyses is required
Competence in advanced data analytics tools (e.g. Python, R, Matlab, Advanced Excel, SQL, Power BI)
An ability to collect, analyse and interpret complex quantitative data and information
An ability to communicate and collaborate with both technical and non-technical parties
Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills
A genuine interest in energy economics and the energy transition
Proficiency (C1 level) in English and Italian
Existing knowledge or experience in the power sector or a related field
Knowledge of power system simulation tools
Knowledge of the Italian power markets
The opportunity to substantially influence major decisions in the energy sector
Direct engagement with clients through Aurora conferences, workshops and webinars
The opportunity to grow into a publicly visible industry expert
A fun, informal, collaborative, and international work culture
Access to regular coaching and mentoring sessions and the opportunity to learn from experienced professionals
Access to the Aurora Academy, our training programme offering a range of opportunities to develop your skills within the responsibilities of your role and within the wider context of the industry

Access to our Employee Assistance Programme (EAP), offering a complete support network that offers expert advice and compassionate guidance 24/7/365, covering a wide range of personal and professional aspects

At Aurora we will consider all requests for flexible working. For most roles, the following types of flexibility are usually possible: a hybrid model of remote and in-office working and flexible start and finish times. Please talk to us during the interview about the flexibility we could offer and we will be happy to explore the best available option for you.

The Company is committed to the principle that no employee or job applicant shall receive unfavourable treatment on grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity.
The successful candidate would start by March 2025. The team will review applications as they are received. Salary will be competitive with experience.
To apply, please submit your R√©sum√© / CV, a personal summary, your salary expectations and please inform us of your notice period.

Department: Research

Location: Rome, Italy

Description

Joining our Rome Research team, you will play an active role in delivering Aurora's Italian power market forecasts, energy policy analysis and client facing services. In particular, the Analyst will help the development of an Italian power grid model, becoming the expert on grid-related issues for the Italian market. In doing so, you will help to guide utilities, investors, and government through the fundamental transition European power markets are facing.

The successful applicant will combine strong quantitative ability with a track record of performance in team-oriented environments. You will work in a dynamic, intellectually stimulating, and demanding yet supportive environment. You will enjoy autonomy, the opportunity to substantially influence major decisions in the energy sector, and to grow into an industry expert under the guidance of directors with deep experience addressing major strategic issues at the world's leading advisory firms.

The position suits a candidate with 1-2 years of work experience, preferably in positions related to power market modelling. Exact entry position will be dependent on experience and educational level.

We are looking for the candidate to begin the role by March 2025

Key Responsibilities


  • Carry out quantitative analysis to deliver our power market forecasts and related analysis

  • Support the development of a grid model for the Italian power system, working closely with our modelling team

  • Monitor market activity, keeping up to date on the latest market developments

  • Deliver both online and in-person presentations and workshops to a broad range of client

  • Work closely with our modelling team, structuring economic problems into quantifiable analyses and deriving insights from the model results

  • Contribute to Aurora's product development, by identifying new opportunities and expanding our capabilities

  • Contribute to the expansion of Aurora's research topics and analytical tools



What we are looking for

Required attributes:

  • Master's degree in a quantitative subject (e.g. Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Finance)

  • 1-2 years' experience in quantitative analyses is required

  • Competence in advanced data analytics tools (e.g. Python, R, Matlab, Advanced Excel, SQL, Power BI)

  • An ability to collect, analyse and interpret complex quantitative data and information

  • An ability to communicate and collaborate with both technical and non-technical parties

  • Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills

  • A genuine interest in energy economics and the energy transition

  • Strong teamworking and problem-solving skills

  • Proficiency (C1 level) in English and Italian


Beneficial attributes:

  • Existing knowledge or experience in the power sector or a related field

  • Knowledge of power system simulation tools

  • Knowledge of the Italian power markets



What we offer


  • The opportunity to substantially influence major decisions in the energy sector

  • Direct engagement with clients through Aurora conferences, workshops and webinars

  • The opportunity to grow into a publicly visible industry expert

  • A fun, informal, collaborative, and international work culture

  • A competitive salary package

  • Access to regular coaching and mentoring sessions and the opportunity to learn from experienced professionals

  • Access to the Aurora Academy, our training programme offering a range of opportunities to develop your skills within the responsibilities of your role and within the wider context of the industry

  • Access to our Employee Assistance Programme (EAP), offering a complete support network that offers expert advice and compassionate guidance 24/7/365, covering a wide range of personal and professional aspects


At Aurora we will consider all requests for flexible working. For most roles, the following types of flexibility are usually possible: a hybrid model of remote and in-office working and flexible start and finish times. Please talk to us during the interview about the flexibility we could offer and we will be happy to explore the best available option for you.

The Company is committed to the principle that no employee or job applicant shall receive unfavourable treatment on grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity.

The successful candidate would start by March 2025. The team will review applications as they are received. Salary will be competitive with experience.

To apply, please submit your R√©sum√© / CV, a personal summary, your salary expectations and please inform us of your notice period.

4125953844,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-analyst-at-bettingjobs-4125953844?position=18&pageNum=0&refId=KW7dU5BcEu2SoSIdYvmJ4g%3D%3D&trackingId=2GhReMdV63jgzhFkxo%2BG%2BA%3D%3D,Digital Analyst,BettingJobs,"Rome, Latium, Italy","BettingJobs is collaborating with a highly-regarded iGaming consultancy, who are currently in search of a talented Digital Analyst to join their dynamic team in Rome.

In this role, you will be responsible for shaping and overseeing the technical infrastructure for market intelligence products, along with implementing systems for web scraping to collect valuable market insights.

Preparing international market research in the online gambling sector (regulatory model of countries, main trends, KPIs, operator benchmarks, gaming offers, relevant developments, traffic estimates, market share analysis, etc.)
Managing different phases of the projects including: entry strategy, business planning, strategic positioning, project management, business development, compliance procedures
Being owner of digital products, defining the product strategy, roadmap, prioritizing requirements, and coordinating the product life cycle and development
Actively participate in the definition of the digital products technical stack, digital tools and integrations with third party products and technologies
Being responsible of the data entry, data categorization and normalization for a brand-new product developed internally

Analyzing the product dataset to find relevant insights and KPIs, detect and communicate interesting promotions, identify the strategy and approach per operator, etc., including the preparation of presentations on the performance of different aspects of the gambling industry, with special focus on the promotional landscape supporting in other internal products and projects
The desired profile: the ideal Candidates will have:
Obtained or in in the process to obtain a Degree in Engineering, Economics, Business Administration or Finance
Fluent knowledge of the Italian and English language. Spanish will be a plus
Python and/or other programming languages knowledge and interest in technology and digital trends
Excellent analytical, organizational, problem solving and communication skills, initiative, goal orientation and teamwork attitude complete the profile
Experience/interest in the gambling industry will be a plus
Full involvement in the Gambling & Management Consulting sector currently undergoing strong development, participating firsthand in high impact decision-making processes
A stimulating, dynamic, and highly motivating work environment that involves direct relationships with Client at the top level (C-Level)
Goal-oriented work, full-time, with flexible hours
A professional development project in a rapidly growing company
An interesting remuneration linked to the candidate's profile
An incentive system linked to the achievement of objectives and a fast and stimulating career path

BettingJobs is collaborating with a highly-regarded iGaming consultancy, who are currently in search of a talented Digital Analyst to join their dynamic team in Rome.


In this role, you will be responsible for shaping and overseeing the technical infrastructure for market intelligence products, along with implementing systems for web scraping to collect valuable market insights.



The main tasks will include:

  • Preparing international market research in the online gambling sector (regulatory model of countries, main trends, KPIs, operator benchmarks, gaming offers, relevant developments, traffic estimates, market share analysis, etc.)
  • Managing different phases of the projects including: entry strategy, business planning, strategic positioning, project management, business development, compliance procedures
  • Being owner of digital products, defining the product strategy, roadmap, prioritizing requirements, and coordinating the product life cycle and development
  • Actively participate in the definition of the digital products technical stack, digital tools and integrations with third party products and technologies
  • Being responsible of the data entry, data categorization and normalization for a brand-new product developed internally
  • Analyzing the product dataset to find relevant insights and KPIs, detect and communicate interesting promotions, identify the strategy and approach per operator, etc., including the preparation of presentations on the performance of different aspects of the gambling industry, with special focus on the promotional landscape supporting in other internal products and projects


The desired profile: the ideal Candidates will have:

  • Obtained or in in the process to obtain a Degree in Engineering, Economics, Business Administration or Finance
  • Fluent knowledge of the Italian and English language. Spanish will be a plus
  • Knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint
  • Python and/or other programming languages knowledge and interest in technology and digital trends
  • Excellent analytical, organizational, problem solving and communication skills, initiative, goal orientation and teamwork attitude complete the profile
  • Experience/interest in the gambling industry will be a plus


What They offer:

  • Full involvement in the Gambling &
column2:
Management Consulting sector currently undergoing strong development, participating firsthand in high impact decision-making processes
  • A stimulating, dynamic, and highly motivating work environment that involves direct relationships with Client at the top level (C-Level)
  • Goal-oriented work, full-time, with flexible hours

  • An interesting remuneration linked to the candidate's profile

4117103416,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/specialista-anagrafica-asset-e-consistenza-at-terna-spa-4117103416?position=21&pageNum=0&refId=KW7dU5BcEu2SoSIdYvmJ4g%3D%3D&trackingId=52HNDMT8tZdR8EkTU2tPOw%3D%3D,Specialista Anagrafica Asset e Consistenza,Terna SpA,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Terna, gestore della rete di trasmissione nazionale (RTN), √® impegnata nel processo di transizione ecologica e come regista del sistema elettrico e abilitatore della transizione energetica, ha il compito di sviluppare una rete in grado di gestire una sempre migliore integrazione delle rinnovabili e consentire la progressiva decarbonizzazione del sistema, garantendo al contempo il costante bilanciamento tra energia prodotta e consumata.
Vuoi essere protagonista della transizione energetica e vuoi dare il tuo contributo per la costruzione del sistema energetico di domani?

La ricerca √® relativa all‚Äôinserimento di una risorsa come Specialista Anagrafica Asset e Consistenza all'interno della struttura Asset Intelligence di Terna. Il ruolo prevede la responsabilit√† di gestire e mantenere accurati i dati anagrafici degli asset aziendali, collaborando con diverse strutture per garantire informazioni sempre aggiornate, integrate e coerenti, a supporto dei processi di Asset Management.
In qualit√† di Specialista Anagrafica Asset e Consistenza svolgerai le seguenti attivit√†:

Supportare il processo di raccolta, validazione e armonizzazione dei dati di consistenza impianti, collaborando con strutture territoriali e fornitori esterni, per garantire un allineamento continuo tra dati digitali e condizioni operative reali
Assicurare una gestione accurata e coordinata delle informazioni di sviluppo rete e, pi√π in generale, delle evolutive asset, garantendo coerenza e continuit√† con la consistenza impianti
Implementare e monitorare standard di data governance per migliorare la qualit√† e l'integrit√† dei dati, riducendo i margini di errore nei processi operativi
Supportare la digitalizzazione dei dati di consistenza impianti, favorendo l'adozione di tecnologie come GIS e strumenti di analisi
Definire e implementare regole per la classificazione e la gerarchizzazione degli asset, garantendo una rappresentazione accurata della rete infrastrutturale

Assicurare l'allineamento tra i dati di consistenza impianti e i sistemi di gestione aziendale (ad esempio, SAP PM, IBM Maximo), promuovendo l'integrazione tra i diversi software utilizzati in azienda
Contribuire alla redazione e allo sviluppo di istruzioni operative per l'utilizzo dei sistemi integrati di Asset Management, con particolare attenzione alla gestione delle anagrafiche
Produrre reportistica periodica e analisi sui dati di consistenza, fornendo insight utili per la pianificazione degli interventi di manutenzione e per le decisioni strategiche
Collaborare alla gestione e armonizzazione delle anagrafiche per System Operator e Transmission Operator, favorendo una piena integrazione dei processi
Contribuire al miglioramento continuo delle metodologie di Asset Management, supportando la transizione verso modelli predittivi e data-driven.
Laurea in discipline tecniche o diploma con esperienza pluriennale in ruoli analoghi, preferibilmente in ambito elettrotecnico
Esperienza professionale in ambiti infrastrutturali o di Asset Management, con conoscenza dei relativi processi operativi e gestionali

Solide competenze nell'uso avanzato di Excel per la modellazione dati e l'analisi quantitativa, incluse funzioni avanzate e tabelle pivot, e di strumenti di visualizzazione dati, in particolare Microsoft Power BI
Conoscenza di base di linguaggi di programmazione come Python (o R) e SQL per l'elaborazione e gestione di dati complessi
Forte orientamento al problem solving, con eccellenti capacit√† nell'analizzare e interpretare grandi volumi di dati complessi e trasformarli in insight significativi per il business
Familiarit√† con sistemi di gestione anagrafica e con piattaforme come SAP (modulo PM) e IBM Maximo
Familiarit√† con sistemi di gestione anagrafica e piattaforme GIS (Geographic Information System), con competenze nell'analisi e nella rappresentazione spaziale dei dati infrastrutturali
Conoscenza del settore della gestione degli asset e delle infrastrutture Terna, con una solida comprensione dei processi di asset management e delle metodologie di data quality
Eccellenti capacit√† relazionali ed empatiche, con un'attitudine collaborativa per mantenere un ambiente di lavoro armonioso
Adattabilit√† e flessibilit√† per interfacciarsi efficacemente con team interfunzionali e contribuire attivamente al raggiungimento degli obiettivi aziendali.

Offriamo un contesto in cui le persone possano in modo efficace collaborare, essere intraprendenti e partecipare alla costruzione di un ambiente di lavoro innovativo e orientato al benessere organizzativo. Siamo impegnati a valorizzare l'unicit√† di tutti in una comunit√† di lavoro inclusiva e a prendere in considerazione le candidature con le qualifiche richieste, offrendo pari opportunit√† di lavoro.‚Äã Assicuriamo a tutte le nostre persone un programma di on boarding, sessioni di training mediante Terna Academy e processi di sviluppo per il miglioramento personale.
√à possibile candidarsi entro e non oltre il 29/01/2025 cliccando su ‚ÄúCandidati ora‚Äù. Referente per la selezione: Simona Sapio - talentacquisition@terna.it

Ricordiamo che i CV inviati tramite e-mail non verranno presi in considerazione. I candidati considerati in linea con il profilo saranno contattati nelle prossime settimane. Ringraziamo tutti gli altri che hanno inviato la propria candidatura per l‚Äôinteresse dimostrato verso il nostro Gruppo e confermiamo che la candidatura sar√† tenuta in considerazione nel caso di ulteriori future opportunit√† professionali.

Terna, gestore della rete di trasmissione nazionale (RTN), √® impegnata nel processo di transizione ecologica e come regista del sistema elettrico e abilitatore della transizione energetica, ha il compito di sviluppare una rete in grado di gestire una sempre migliore integrazione delle rinnovabili e consentire la progressiva decarbonizzazione del sistema, garantendo al contempo il costante bilanciamento tra energia prodotta e consumata.

4119780992,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analytics-insight-internship-at-procter-gamble-4119780992?position=24&pageNum=0&refId=KW7dU5BcEu2SoSIdYvmJ4g%3D%3D&trackingId=2AyGmbc%2BFsXT9n0lZlrC3g%3D%3D,Analytics & Insight Internship,Procter & Gamble,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Job Location

Do you have a passion to influence business strategy, product design, commercial vision and the media landscape? An ambition to drive the change through deep consumer understanding and advanced analytics is also what we are looking for!
If so, then this role is perfect for you!

In Analytics & Insights (A&I), we use our boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it and how we can we influence them through immersive exploration and big data analytics. We uncover unexpected insights and innovate the way P&G runs business.
A career in A&I will build your ability to influence and think strategically, across a breadth of experiences on multiple P&G business.
As An Intern In Analytics And Insights, You Will
Act as a business strategy consultant, guiding decisions of P&G Top management in several business domains (consumer, customer, digital etc.)
Be part of a multi-functional business team, working closely with Marketing, Finance, Sales, R&D and others, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth
Combine analytical expertise and deep consumer understanding, to anticipate opportunities and answer critical business questions

Grow your skills continuously, improving your mastery in big data analytics, as well as immersive in-depth researches. You will have the opportunity to explore new ways to learn and to connect with internal and external guides worldwide.
Responsibilities as of Day 1 ‚Äì You will be given specific projects and responsibilities working on real and live business challenges, just like a true P&Ger
Continuous coaching ‚Äì You will work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager
Dynamic and respectful work environment ‚Äì Employees are at the core, we value every individual and encourage initiatives, promoting work/life balance
Compensation & Benefits: you will receive a competitive internship salary as well as other benefits whilst you are with us.
Just apply online via clicking the button below
Attach any documents you consider relevant: motivation letter, recommendations, certificates etc.
Master students or recent graduates with strong analytical skills and Integrative thinking
Proven leadership and teamwork skills, with a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù approach and an unusual skew to innovate
Boundless curiosity and the passion to generate results
Data Analytics background represents a plus
Have creativity, innovation, initiative and follow-through with your goals, along with strong written and verbal communication skills
Are fluent in Italian and have an excellent ability to communicate in English
Are available for a minimum of 3 months, preferably 6 months internship.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate against individuals based on race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, veteran status, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.
At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.
Our mission of Diversity and Inclusion is: ‚ÄúEveryone valued. Everyone included. Everyone performing at their peak‚Äù.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Eccellenti risultati accademici preferibilmente con laurea in materie economiche, scientifiche, ingegneristiche.

la realizzazione di pipeline di data ingestion e di data preparation

il coordinamento dell‚Äôanalisi e la messa a terra di applicazioni complesse, basate su tecnologie afferenti all‚Äôambito dati che spaziano da piattaforme tradizionali di Datawarehouse ed ETL (DataStage, Teradata, ...), alle tecnologie di Analytics e Reporting (esempio: Microsoft PowerBI, ...), per arrivare fino alle tecnologie di Big Data (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, ...) e Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence (es. Python).
la partecipazione proattiva all‚Äôinnovazione e all‚Äôottimizzazione dei processi aziendali, anche tramite scouting di tool di mercato legati al mondo Data Science, Data Engineering e Data Governance

Since 2016, we have been steadily growing to provide more than just casino games and sports betting events to enjoy
column2: With us, you can enjoy unique bonuses and earn massive rewards simultaneously. Discover all the rewarding features Gamdom can offer you below.

column1: Gamdom is seeking a Technical Data Analyst to join our growing data team. Reporting to the Reporting and Analytics Lead, this role offers the opportunity to work across multiple areas of the casino industry, supporting the delivery of impactful data solutions to drive business decisions.

In this role, you will focus on implementing and maintaining key data reporting and analytics processes, ensuring that data models, dashboards, and reports are optimized and meet business needs. Your strong technical skills, particularly in SQL and data visualization, will contribute to the seamless delivery of insights and robust data products.
Build, maintain, and enhance dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, ensuring accuracy and alignment with business requirements.
Support the Reporting and Analytics Lead and other team members by implementing technical solutions based on gathered requirements from stakeholders.
Work with the finance team to refine and document key business metrics and KPIs.
Assist the CRM and marketing teams with customer segmentation, campaign analysis, and actionable insights to improve performance.
Collaborate with data engineers to design and implement data models in the Data Warehouse, ensuring scalability and usability.
Document and standardize reporting processes, making them accessible and consistent across the organization.
Conduct ad hoc analyses to answer critical business questions and support decision-making.
Contribute to data governance efforts, ensuring data quality, consistency, and usability.
2‚Äì4 years of experience in a data analytics or reporting role, preferably in the casino or iGaming industry.
Experience working in a structured way, using a backlog management tool like Jira to prioritize and manage activities.
Strong proficiency in SQL for querying, transforming, and analyzing data.
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI, including creating and optimizing dashboards.
Knowledge of data modeling and an understanding of data warehousing principles.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to deliver accurate and reliable outputs.
Excellent attention to detail, ensuring data and reporting consistency.
Familiarity with privacy implications surrounding the usage of personal data for analytics.
University Degree ideally in a Mathematical, Statistical, or related field (preferred).

Gamdom is home to thousands of betting options for both sports and casino players to wager on. Since 2016, we have been steadily growing to provide more than just casino games and sports betting events to enjoy

With us, you can enjoy unique bonuses and earn massive rewards simultaneously. Discover all the rewarding features Gamdom can offer you below.

Gamdom is seeking a Technical Data Analyst to join our growing data team. Reporting to the Reporting and Analytics Lead, this role offers the opportunity to work across multiple areas of the casino industry, supporting the delivery of impactful data solutions to drive business decisions.

In this role, you will focus on implementing and maintaining key data reporting and analytics processes, ensuring that data models, dashboards, and reports are optimized and meet business needs. Your strong technical skills, particularly in SQL and data visualization, will contribute to the seamless delivery of insights and robust data products.

Responsibilities

  • Build, maintain, and enhance dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, ensuring accuracy and alignment with business requirements.
  • Support the Reporting and Analytics Lead and other team members by implementing technical solutions based on gathered requirements from stakeholders.
  • Work with the finance team to refine and document key business metrics and KPIs.
  • Assist the CRM and marketing teams with customer segmentation, campaign analysis, and actionable insights to improve performance.
  • Collaborate with data engineers to design and implement data models in the Data Warehouse, ensuring scalability and usability.
  • Document and standardize reporting processes, making them accessible and consistent across the organization.
  • Conduct ad hoc analyses to answer critical business questions and support decision-making.
  • Contribute to data governance efforts, ensuring data quality, consistency, and usability.

Required Skills &
column3:
Competencies

  • 2‚Äì4 years of experience in a data analytics or reporting role, preferably in the casino or iGaming industry.
  • Experience working in a structured way, using a backlog management tool like Jira to prioritize and manage activities.
  • Strong proficiency in SQL for querying, transforming, and analyzing data.
  • Hands-on experience with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI, including creating and optimizing dashboards.
  • Knowledge of data modeling and an understanding of data warehousing principles.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to deliver accurate and reliable outputs.
  • Excellent attention to detail, ensuring data and reporting consistency.
  • Familiarity with privacy implications surrounding the usage of personal data for analytics.
  • University Degree ideally in a Mathematical, Statistical, or related field (preferred).

marketing analytics: measurement of marketing campaigns with a focus on causality, optimization and data-driven decision-making

new graduate in Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Physics
analytical mindset with a problem solving approach
curious and passionate about marketing and tech platforms
fluent in English and working knowledge of Italian.

performance marketing: we design, create and manage campaigns with different business objectives (e.g. user acquisition and engagement, lead generation and brand awareness). market and competitor insights: we study the real estate market and our industry to uncover emerging trends, discover business opportunities and forecast demand as accurately as possible to stay ahead of the curve
projects: we drive growth, operational and technological improvements working cross-team and cross-competence (Tech, Product, Sales, PR & Content teams).
a young and dynamic work environment
an opportunity in a fast-growing company
paid internship contract or fixed contract
free coffee and fresh fruit every day
break room with a foosball table
office located in the centre of Rome (Termini).

4131280263,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/remote-data-contributor-no-experience-needed-at-transperfect-4131280263?position=48&pageNum=0&refId=KW7dU5BcEu2SoSIdYvmJ4g%3D%3D&trackingId=TQlCi30C5LL8VG%2BmKJx5Qw%3D%3D,Remote Data Contributor - No Experience Needed,TransPerfect,"Tivoli, Latium, Italy","Position: Data Contributor
Project Location: Remote from Belgium, France, Germany, Italy, or Switzerland.
Engagement Model: One-time task, task based
We are currently looking for contributors to participate in our Wharf remote project!

This project aims at collecting text messages, emails, and emails with attachments that you have received for booking confirmations, changes, or cancellations related to Belgium and Switzerland after November 2022.
The collection purpose is to help improve and test features, services, and algorithms by training advanced machine learning systems such as neural networks and generative models.

You can submit personal text messages, emails, and emails with attachments in French (for bookings related to Belgium or Switzerland), German or Italian (for bookings related to Switzerland) from a variety of categories:
Travel: Flights, Hotels, Car rentals, Ticketed ground transport (e.g., train, bus, ferry)
Entertainment: Tickets for movies, shows, sports and other events, Party invitations originating from event providers

Appointments: Doctor appointments, dentist appointments, personal care appointments (e.g., oral hygienist, physical therapist, etc.), appointments for family members (e.g., children‚Äôs doctor appointments).

Using our DataForce proprietary platform, you will share assets (text messages, emails, and emails with attachments) from your personal computer (desktop or laptop) or mobile device, according to the instructions that will be shared with you if you qualify for the project.
You can submit as many assets as you wish for the open categories.
Our team will identify and remove any personal information (e.g., your name) contained in your assets before they are used in our project.
You will receive $3.5 USD per each accepted asset, via PayPal, Gift Card or Wire Transfer, according to your preference.
If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at: DataForce.Sourcing@transperfect.com

DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world‚Äôs largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.

We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our division focuses on gathering, enriching and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.
To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce

Position: Data Contributor

Project Location: Remote from Belgium, France, Germany, Italy, or Switzerland.

We are currently looking for contributors to participate in our Wharf remote project!


What is the project about?

This project aims at collecting text messages, emails, and emails with attachments that you have received for booking confirmations, changes, or cancellations related to Belgium and Switzerland after November 2022.


The collection purpose is to help improve and test features, services, and algorithms by training advanced machine learning systems such as neural networks and generative models.


You can submit personal text messages, emails, and emails with attachments in French (for bookings related to Belgium or Switzerland), German or Italian (for bookings related to Switzerland) from a variety of categories:


Travel: Flights, Hotels, Car rentals, Ticketed ground transport (e.g., train, bus, ferry)
column2: Entertainment: Tickets for movies, shows, sports and other events, Party invitations originating from event providers
column3:
Appointments: Doctor appointments, dentist appointments, personal care appointments (e.g., oral hygienist, physical therapist, etc.), appointments for family members (e.g., children‚Äôs doctor appointments).


Task Description

Using our DataForce proprietary platform, you will share assets (text messages, emails, and emails with attachments) from your personal computer (desktop or laptop) or mobile device, according to the instructions that will be shared with you if you qualify for the project.

Our team will identify and remove any personal information (e.g., your name) contained in your assets before they are used in our project.

4131189552,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-scientist-for-global-p-c-pricing-team-at-allianz-4131189552?position=50&pageNum=0&refId=KW7dU5BcEu2SoSIdYvmJ4g%3D%3D&trackingId=8J1mZ47YH2XOqkBMDDUNrA%3D%3D,JUNIOR DATA SCIENTIST for Global P&C Pricing Team,Allianz,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Global P&C is an Allianz SE department established in 2011 as continuation of the Center of Competence project started in 2005. Its mission is supporting all Allianz P&C Entities to be outstanding in technical excellence by leveraging Allianz Capabilities.

Global P&C Pricing team is responsible for identifying, supporting implementation and ensuring standards, best practices and guidelines for data management, tariff development, portfolio analysis and monitoring. Specifically, the team oversees:

Joint projects with the Allianz local entities around the world: we collaborate with local entities on pricing projects concerning mainly technical pricing, behavioural models, price optimization, scenario analysis, development of pricing and portfolio management tools.
Research and development on Data & Analytics and tools to enhance the level of sophistication always considering the business relevance and impact
Knowledge sharing and training of best practices: we design and facilitate P&C Pricing Academy courses to the wide community of pricing analyst of Allianz Group.

Review activities: periodically we review the full pricing process of each local entity to ensure the standardization and harmonization of pricing processes and the implementation of best practices across the group.
Support the data ingestion, transformation, cleaning and exploration procedures
Structuring data science solutions to achieve a given set of business objectives
Build and prototype analysis and Machine Learning models and support their implementation and deployment in the systems of the company
Model customer‚Äôs behavior based on market and competitor‚Äôs analysis
Implement and enhance dashboards and business intelligence tools to support risk analysis and portfolio management
Doing Research and Development to find new technical solutions
Summarize, design and communicate effectively the results to both internal and external stakeholders
Act as teacher for internal Pricing Academy courses
PhD or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or Engineering)
Fluent in Italian and English, written and spoken
Valued international experience in both academic and professional settings
Experience with Pandas or SQL for data manipulation and analysis
Familiarity with machine learning techniques like gradient boosting machines and linear models
Experience with PySpark for large-scale data processing would be an advantage
Passionate and skilled in data analysis and statistical modelling to support strategic decisions
Demonstrated ability to work effectively as part of a diverse, multicultural and multidisciplinary team

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.
We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.
Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.
Both genders may apply in accordance with the L. 903/77 (s.m.i).

4130555329,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/remote-data-contributor-no-experience-needed-at-transperfect-4130555329?position=56&pageNum=0&refId=KW7dU5BcEu2SoSIdYvmJ4g%3D%3D&trackingId=1umrfAHxxoWnBYSZTrVvcg%3D%3D,Remote Data Contributor - No Experience Needed,TransPerfect,"Fiumicino, Latium, Italy","Position: Data Contributor
Project Location: Remote from Belgium, France, Germany, Italy, or Switzerland.
Engagement Model: One-time task, task based
We are currently looking for contributors to participate in our Wharf remote project!

This project aims at collecting text messages, emails, and emails with attachments that you have received for booking confirmations, changes, or cancellations related to Belgium and Switzerland after November 2022.
The collection purpose is to help improve and test features, services, and algorithms by training advanced machine learning systems such as neural networks and generative models.

You can submit personal text messages, emails, and emails with attachments in French (for bookings related to Belgium or Switzerland), German or Italian (for bookings related to Switzerland) from a variety of categories:
Travel: Flights, Hotels, Car rentals, Ticketed ground transport (e.g., train, bus, ferry)
Entertainment: Tickets for movies, shows, sports and other events, Party invitations originating from event providers

Appointments: Doctor appointments, dentist appointments, personal care appointments (e.g., oral hygienist, physical therapist, etc.), appointments for family members (e.g., children‚Äôs doctor appointments).

Using our DataForce proprietary platform, you will share assets (text messages, emails, and emails with attachments) from your personal computer (desktop or laptop) or mobile device, according to the instructions that will be shared with you if you qualify for the project.
You can submit as many assets as you wish for the open categories.
Our team will identify and remove any personal information (e.g., your name) contained in your assets before they are used in our project.
You will receive $3.5 USD per each accepted asset, via PayPal, Gift Card or Wire Transfer, according to your preference.
If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at: DataForce.Sourcing@transperfect.com

DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world‚Äôs largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.

We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our division focuses on gathering, enriching and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.
To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce

What is the project about?

The collection purpose is to help improve and test features, services, and algorithms by training advanced machine learning systems such as neural networks and generative models.

Innovazione, tecnologia e impiego avanzato e consapevole dei dati sono gli ingredienti che rendono ConTe.it una insurtech di successo con un modello organizzativo agile, flessibile e che valorizza il talento.
Siamo alla ricerca di un/una brillante neolaureato/a che voglia partecipare a un progetto sfidante e che stia cercando un‚Äôopportunit√† per lasciare la propria impronta nel business.
Sarai coinvolto in un periodo di training on the job della durata di un anno, durante il quale riceverai feedback periodici attraverso un coaching dedicato.

Nel ruolo di Data Analyst, farai parte del Team Portfolio Analysis e avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di dare un contributo all‚Äôottimizzazione della selezione del rischio e alla profittabilit√† del Gruppo Admiral.
Contribuire, in qualit√† di Data Analyst, all‚Äôanalisi della struttura tariffaria per supportare la Compagnia assicurativa di riferimento nella creazione di nuovi vantaggi competitivi.
Lavorare su Project Work entrando in contatto diretto con i Senior Manager delle diverse funzioni aziendali.
Conoscere in dettaglio il business del Gruppo Admiral attraverso un affiancamento strutturato.
Acquisire competenze professionali necessarie per una brillante carriera nel business assicurativo.
Eccellenti risultati accademici preferibilmente con laurea in materie economiche, scientifiche, ingegneristiche.
Disponibilit√† di lavoro a tempo pieno.
Potenziale di crescita verso ruoli manageriali.
Completano il profilo spirito di teamwork e orientamento agli obiettivi, spiccate doti analitiche e problem solving, creativit√†, capacit√† relazionali.
Entrando a far parte della famiglia ConTe.it scoprirai:
Un posto dove poter essere sempre te stesso! Siamo giovani, informali e pensiamo che diversity e inclusione siano valori fondamentali da preservare ed enfatizzare.

4123155167,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analista-business-intelligence-at-agap2-italia-4123155167?position=3&pageNum=2&refId=BPVGuQ%2FIZKGntcJiyQj1WQ%3D%3D&trackingId=2cabpO%2F8SYwU6ER9AmwJYg%3D%3D,Analista business intelligence,agap2 Italia,"Tivoli, Latium, Italy","CHI SIAMO

AGAP2 √® un gruppo europeo di consulenza ingegneristica e operativa, parte del Gruppo MoOngy. Presenti in 14 paesi europei con oltre 8.500 dipendenti, abbiamo inaugurato la nostra prima sede italiana a Milano sei anni fa. Nell'ottica di rafforzare il nostro team, stiamo cercando un Analista Business Intelligence per un'opportunit√†, in modalit√† ibrida, presso la sede di una nostra Azienda cliente a Tivoli (RM).
Progettare, sviluppare e mantenere soluzioni di Business Intelligence utilizzando Power BI e Tableau.

Preparare documentazione tecnica e fornire formazione ai team aziendali sull'utilizzo degli strumenti BI sviluppati.
2-3 anni di esperienza in ambito Business Intelligence, con un focus su progettazione e implementazione di soluzioni.
Ottima padronanza di Power BI e Tableau, incluse funzionalit√† avanzate di visualizzazione e modellazione dei dati.
Conoscenza delle tecniche di analisi dati, data warehousing e integrazione di fonti dati eterogenee.
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata.
Capacit√† analitiche e attenzione ai dettagli per garantire la massima precisione nei report.
Ottime doti comunicative e capacit√† di collaborare con team multidisciplinari.
Orientamento al miglioramento continuo e alla risoluzione di problemi complessi.
Contratto a tempo indeterminato con buoni pasto e indennit√†.
Strumenti di formazione per sviluppare sia le competenze tecniche che le soft skills.
Follow-up costante con il team HR per garantire il tuo sviluppo professionale.
Opportunit√† di crescita in un ambiente dinamico e stimolante.

AGAP2 √® un equal opportunities employer: crediamo che tutte le forme di diversit√† siano fonte di arricchimento reciproco. Ci impegniamo a garantire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, nel quale ogni singola risorsa possa apportare un valore unico alla nostra realt√†. Pertanto, accogliamo candidature senza distinzione di et√†, genere, nazionalit√†, disabilit√†, orientamento sessuale, religione o stato civile.
Inoltre, teniamo fede ai nostri impegni prestando attenzione alle risorse appartenenti alle categorie protette ai sensi degli articoli 1 e 18 della Legge 68/99.
I dati personali saranno trattati in conformit√† alle disposizioni contenute nel regolamento UE 2016/679.

CHI SIAMO

We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.
We are looking for an Data Engineer to join the Operations & Technology Department of our Group.
Degree or diploma in a scientific/computer/statistical field or proven experience in data processing and the application of statistical/mathematical/Machine Learning models.

4128311269,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/trainee-data-analyst-career-accelerator-with-employment-guarantee-at-nuyew-tech-academy-4128311269?position=10&pageNum=2&refId=BPVGuQ%2FIZKGntcJiyQj1WQ%3D%3D&trackingId=wbBbatR0K369ynnlcYzOHA%3D%3D,Trainee Data Analyst (Career Accelerator with Employment Guarantee),Nuyew Tech Academy,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data and driving informed decision-making? Are you looking for a structured training program that can kickstart your career in data analysis?
At Nuyew Tech Academy, we specialise in providing aspiring tech professionals like you with the tools, training, and support needed to launch successful careers in this vital industry.

Whether you're starting from scratch or looking to advance your existing skills, our academy offers a comprehensive program designed to cultivate your talent and propel you towards exciting opportunities in data analysis.
What the Data Analysis Career Accelerator at Nuyew Tech Academy includes and what students can expect:
Comprehensive Training: Receive in-depth training in data analysis tools and techniques, including Excel, Databases, Python, Power BI and AI.
Hands-on Experience: Opportunities to gain practical experience through real-world scenarios and virtual labs.

Industry-Recognised Certifications: Preparation for industry-recognised certifications such as CompTIA Data+, Microsoft Power BI Associate and Microsoft Excel Expert to validate skills and enhance employability.
Personalised Support: Dedicated student support team offering guidance, feedback, and support throughout the program to ensure student success.
Career Development: Tailored career guidance, resume building, interview preparation, and job search assistance to help students transition into data analyst roles.
Networking Opportunities: Access to networking events and alumni connections to expand professional networks and explore career opportunities.
Financial Support: Scholarship opportunities and interest free student loans available to make the program accessible and affordable for all aspiring data analyst professionals.
No previous experience or qualifications required
Strong interest in tech and data analysis
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Detail-oriented and strong attention to accuracy and completeness
Willingness to learn and continuously improve technical and professional skills
Career Advancement: Elevate your professional journey with a tailored training course that's designed to set you on the path towards high-demand tech roles.

Competitive Salary Prospects: Upon completing our training and gaining some relevant experience, candidates are poised to secure roles with salaries aligned to what's advertised on the job listing. Invest in your future potential!

Employment Guarantee: If you haven't secured a tech job by course completion, we'll provide additional training and career support until you do. Still not employed after three years? We'll refund your tuition in full, and you keep your certifications. Your future in tech starts with us.
Professional Growth: Broaden your horizons and skill set with diverse professional development opportunities throughout and post-training.
Dynamic Learning Environment: Experience a vibrant and supportive academy atmosphere where innovation meets education.

Affordable Learning: We're committed to making education accessible. The academy career pathway tuition fee of ¬£3995 can be funded by scholarship opportunities and interest free student loans which enable you to spread your tuition fee over 36 months.

Please Note: While we offer robust training and support to help candidates find employment, it's important to clarify that candidates will not be directly employed by Nuyew Tech Academy. Our commitment is to empower you with the skills and support needed to enhance your job prospects in the broader tech industry.

Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data and driving informed decision-making? Are you looking for a structured training program that can kickstart your career in data analysis?

At Nuyew Tech Academy, we specialise in providing aspiring tech professionals like you with the tools, training, and support needed to launch successful careers in this vital industry.

  • Financial Support: Scholarship opportunities and interest free student loans available to make the program accessible and affordable for all aspiring data analyst professionals.

Requirements

  • No previous experience or qualifications required
  • Strong interest in tech and data analysis
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment
  • Detail-oriented and strong attention to accuracy and completeness
  • Willingness to learn and continuously improve technical and professional skills

Benefits

  • Career Advancement: Elevate your professional journey with a tailored training course that's designed to set you on the path towards high-demand tech roles.
  • Competitive Salary Prospects: Upon completing our training and gaining some relevant experience, candidates are poised to secure roles with salaries aligned to what's advertised on the job listing. Invest in your future potential!
  • Employment Guarantee: If you haven't secured a tech job by course completion, we'll provide additional training and career support until you do. Still not employed after three years? We'll refund your tuition in full, and you keep your certifications. Your future in tech starts with us.
  • Professional Growth: Broaden your horizons and skill set with diverse professional development opportunities throughout and post-training.
  • Dynamic Learning Environment: Experience a vibrant and supportive academy atmosphere where innovation meets education.
  • Affordable Learning: We're committed to making education accessible. The academy career pathway tuition fee of ¬£3995 can be funded by scholarship opportunities and interest free student loans which enable you to spread your tuition fee over 36 months.

Please Note: While we offer robust training and support to help candidates find employment, it's important to clarify that candidates will not be directly employed by Nuyew Tech Academy. Our commitment is to empower you with the skills and support needed to enhance your job prospects in the broader tech industry.

4131281156,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/remote-data-contributor-no-experience-needed-at-transperfect-4131281156?position=2&pageNum=5&refId=rHUpoufVRFbb5I6tSe%2BFtQ%3D%3D&trackingId=OpTG1eh1zJxaWXH3PvOI%2BA%3D%3D,Remote Data Contributor - No Experience Needed,TransPerfect,"Pomezia, Latium, Italy","Position: Data Contributor
Project Location: Remote from Belgium, France, Germany, Italy, or Switzerland.
Engagement Model: One-time task, task based
We are currently looking for contributors to participate in our Wharf remote project!

This project aims at collecting text messages, emails, and emails with attachments that you have received for booking confirmations, changes, or cancellations related to Belgium and Switzerland after November 2022.
The collection purpose is to help improve and test features, services, and algorithms by training advanced machine learning systems such as neural networks and generative models.

You can submit personal text messages, emails, and emails with attachments in French (for bookings related to Belgium or Switzerland), German or Italian (for bookings related to Switzerland) from a variety of categories:
Travel: Flights, Hotels, Car rentals, Ticketed ground transport (e.g., train, bus, ferry)
Entertainment: Tickets for movies, shows, sports and other events, Party invitations originating from event providers

Appointments: Doctor appointments, dentist appointments, personal care appointments (e.g., oral hygienist, physical therapist, etc.), appointments for family members (e.g., children‚Äôs doctor appointments).

Using our DataForce proprietary platform, you will share assets (text messages, emails, and emails with attachments) from your personal computer (desktop or laptop) or mobile device, according to the instructions that will be shared with you if you qualify for the project.
You can submit as many assets as you wish for the open categories.
Our team will identify and remove any personal information (e.g., your name) contained in your assets before they are used in our project.
You will receive $3.5 USD per each accepted asset, via PayPal, Gift Card or Wire Transfer, according to your preference.
If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at: DataForce.Sourcing@transperfect.com

DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world‚Äôs largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.

We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our division focuses on gathering, enriching and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.
To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce

Position: Data Contributor

Project Location: Remote from Belgium, France, Germany, Italy, or Switzerland.

Engagement Model: One-time task, task based


We are currently looking for contributors to participate in our Wharf remote project!


What is the project about?

This project aims at collecting text messages, emails, and emails with attachments that you have received for booking confirmations, changes, or cancellations related to Belgium and Switzerland after November 2022.


The collection purpose is to help improve and test features, services, and algorithms by training advanced machine learning systems such as neural networks and generative models.


You can submit personal text messages, emails, and emails with attachments in French (for bookings related to Belgium or Switzerland), German or Italian (for bookings related to Switzerland) from a variety of categories:


Travel: Flights, Hotels, Car rentals, Ticketed ground transport (e.g., train, bus, ferry)
column2: Entertainment: Tickets for movies, shows, sports and other events, Party invitations originating from event providers
column3:
Appointments: Doctor appointments, dentist appointments, personal care appointments (e.g., oral hygienist, physical therapist, etc.), appointments for family members (e.g., children‚Äôs doctor appointments).


Task Description

Using our DataForce proprietary platform, you will share assets (text messages, emails, and emails with attachments) from your personal computer (desktop or laptop) or mobile device, according to the instructions that will be shared with you if you qualify for the project.

You can submit as many assets as you wish for the open categories.


Our team will identify and remove any personal information (e.g., your name) contained in your assets before they are used in our project.

Compensation

You will receive $3.5 USD per each accepted asset, via PayPal, Gift Card or Wire Transfer, according to your preference.

Position: Data Contributor

We are currently looking for contributors to participate in our Wharf remote project!


What is the project about?

This project aims at collecting text messages, emails, and emails with attachments that you have received for booking confirmations, changes, or cancellations related to Belgium and Switzerland within the past 2 years.


The collection purpose is to help improve and test features, services, and algorithms by training advanced machine learning systems such as neural networks and generative models.

Lavorare in BIP √® un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti.¬†

Avrai la possibilit√† di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attivit√† e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l‚Äôautonomia e la capacit√† di assumerti responsabilit√† e metterti in gioco.
Potrai partecipare a + di 300 corsi formativi all‚Äôavanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.
Troverai una policy che supporta¬†lo smartworking¬†fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work-life integration.
Valorizziamo l‚Äôunicit√† e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutti i dipendenti abbiano pari opportunit√† di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro.

Il nostro approccio alla diversit√† e all‚Äôinclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrit√† e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, pi√π ampi.
Promuoviamo l‚Äôinserimento e l‚Äôintegrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette ‚Äì in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99 ‚Äì.
Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prenderemo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente.
Se c‚Äô√® un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all‚Äôinterno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca.
L‚Äôiter di selezione comprende generalmente un colloquio con HR, un colloquio tecnico con un line manager ed un eventuale colloquio con un Partner.
L‚Äôordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting.
In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunit√† future.
Se dovessi identificare ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.

column2:
Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l‚Äôesperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l‚Äôinnovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 5000 professionisti e professioniste, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze pi√π all‚Äôavanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.

Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualit√† su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dell‚Äôeccellenza, che √® la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.

Data Analyst

Quale sar√† la tua sfida?

Entra a far parte di BIP xTech, il Centro di Eccellenza di BIP specializzato in consulenza
column3:
e servizi innovativi in ambito Data Analytics, Big Data, Data Science, RPA, Cloud, Blockchain e Networking.

In particolare, verrai considerato/a per far parte di DANA, il Competence Team di xTech che accoglie i nostri consulenti Data Analyst ‚Äì figure professionali che combinano competenze informatiche e statistiche con l‚Äôinteresse per il business e i processi operativi dei nostri clienti. Il team segue progetti di lungo, medio e breve termine, con attivit√† quali:

• Project management in ambito dati e IT.

4130555329,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/remote-data-contributor-no-experience-needed-at-transperfect-4130555329?position=6&pageNum=5&refId=rHUpoufVRFbb5I6tSe%2BFtQ%3D%3D&trackingId=rVwvBVH6NVdqgH303GgN6w%3D%3D,Remote Data Contributor - No Experience Needed,TransPerfect,"Fiumicino, Latium, Italy","Position: Data Contributor
Project Location: Remote from Belgium, France, Germany, Italy, or Switzerland.
Engagement Model: One-time task, task based
We are currently looking for contributors to participate in our Wharf remote project!

This project aims at collecting text messages, emails, and emails with attachments that you have received for booking confirmations, changes, or cancellations related to Belgium and Switzerland after November 2022.
The collection purpose is to help improve and test features, services, and algorithms by training advanced machine learning systems such as neural networks and generative models.

You can submit personal text messages, emails, and emails with attachments in French (for bookings related to Belgium or Switzerland), German or Italian (for bookings related to Switzerland) from a variety of categories:
Travel: Flights, Hotels, Car rentals, Ticketed ground transport (e.g., train, bus, ferry)
Entertainment: Tickets for movies, shows, sports and other events, Party invitations originating from event providers

Appointments: Doctor appointments, dentist appointments, personal care appointments (e.g., oral hygienist, physical therapist, etc.), appointments for family members (e.g., children‚Äôs doctor appointments).

Using our DataForce proprietary platform, you will share assets (text messages, emails, and emails with attachments) from your personal computer (desktop or laptop) or mobile device, according to the instructions that will be shared with you if you qualify for the project.
You can submit as many assets as you wish for the open categories.
Our team will identify and remove any personal information (e.g., your name) contained in your assets before they are used in our project.
You will receive $3.5 USD per each accepted asset, via PayPal, Gift Card or Wire Transfer, according to your preference.
If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at: DataForce.Sourcing@transperfect.com

DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world‚Äôs largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.

We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our division focuses on gathering, enriching and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.
To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce
